page.title: 09UNEMPLOYMENT (1980s) DUNDEE
page.content: IN April 1985 an estimated 7000 people in the West End of Dundee were unemployed. The job vacancies for Dundee as a whole were estimated at 385, which meant 42 people chasing every job. Many teenagers now are unemployed, whereas in the 1930s it was mostly men who were unemployed. There is concern at the human cost of unemployment with increasing crime etc { Dundee District Council,}working with the{Scottish Development Agency}and other such bodies, are opting for {"self-employed systems",}in the hope that any skilled workers who set up a business will employ unskilled labour and so alleviate the unemployment figures.{The Blackness Project}is a prime example of this scheme. One aspect of this scheme must be noted: for every five businesses set up,only two are reasonably successful.
